thread.title: Ryan Reynolds: Hasty Pudding 2017 Man of the Year
thread.title_full: Ryan Reynolds: Hasty Pudding 2017 Man of the Year - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Ryan Reynolds: Hasty Pudding 2017 Man of the Year
text:
Google+
Matthew J. Lee/Globe staff
Ryan Reynolds after receiving the Hasty Pudding Award gives it a kiss at Farkas Hall.
By Aimee Ortiz Globe Staff February 04, 2017
Hollywood came to Harvard Friday night, when actor Ryan Reynolds accepted Hasty Pudding Theatricals ’ “Man of the Year” honors.
Fresh from a Golden Globe nomination for his record-breaking film “Deadpool,” Reynolds collected the coveted pudding pot at Farkas Hall.
Advertisement
He was feted with the traditional roasting before attending the opening night performance of the troupe’s 169th presentation, “Casino Evil.”
Taking a seat at center stage, Reynolds dared the theatricals to give him their best shot.
Get Fast Forward in your inbox: Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email. Sign Up Thank you for signing up! Sign up for more newsletters here And that they did.
Emcees Natalie Kim and Adam Chiavacci made their way through Reynolds’s extensive film career — including the flops.
Chiavacci started by confusing Reynolds with fellow Canadian actor (and the one who beat him at the Golden Globes), Ryan Gosling .
Advertisement
Listing Gosling’s accomplishments and calling him “very deserving” of a Hasty Pudding award, Chiavacci exclaimed, “Damn! wrong Canadian,” when Kim informed him that it was Reynolds who was here for the celebration.
Kim congratulated Reynolds on his accomplishments (marrying Blake Lively ) and on his new Hollywood Walk of Fame star, letting him know that now Hollywood can “literally walk all over you.”
The roasters’ ribbing at one point prompted Reynolds to burst out laughing, saying that he felt like he was a family dinner. Reynolds said it was a great night for him.
“This is the only reason they’d ever let me in on this campus,” Reynolds said before complimenting the university’s students.
“There’s something pretty exceptional about all these young men and women, because, it’s sort of like hanging out with a bunch of people with the acumen of a worldly 40-year-old.”
Reynolds is the 51st man to win the award from the Harvard organization. The Hasty Pudding 2017 Woman of the Year, Octavia Spencer , was awarded her Pudding Pot last week following a parade and roast.

Ryan Reynolds during the Hasty Pudding Award.
Matthew J. Lee/Globe staff

Matthew J. Lee/Globe staff
Scott Hall (Richard Simmons), Natalie Kim (emcee), and Ryan Reynolds as he was roasted.
Matthew J. Lee/Globe staff
Ryan Reynolds received the Hasty Pudding Award at Farkas Hall.
Aimee Ortiz can be reached at aimee.ortiz@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @aimee_ortiz .
